intro: Minuartia doerfleri, commonly known as the snow-in-summer, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit with dense, fleshy leaves that help it conserve moisture. Its unique appearance and ability to bloom in cold climates make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes.
